channel.title: piplined protocols on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in piplined protocols on Notes

item.title: CS138-lecture-20210330
item.description: Piplined protocols # Go-back-n # unacked = unacknowledged = no ACK response, not confirmed for success yet. The number of bits needed for a \( k \) -bit sequence numbers is \( 2^k - 1 \) . The window size is \( N = 2^k \) . The packet number that can be used for cumulative ack should be the largest number before any gap.
